docs.lead_paragraph: A 1968 car crash in France and the 1998 diagnosis of Ann Romney’s multiple sclerosis offer clues into Mitt Romney’s character, and how he reacts to challenges.

headline.main: Romney in Crisis: Two Dark Spots in Fortunate Life
headline.print_headline: Romney in Crisis: 2 Dark Spots in Fortunate Life

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney's advisers will seek to humanize him during the Republican National Convention in Tampa, Fla, making use of two key stories--his wife Ann's struggle with multiple sclerosis and his near-fatal car crash in 1968; advisers believe the two stories will help construct a 'crisis narrative' in what has otherwise seemed a charmed existence for Romney (Series: The Long Run).
docs.snippet: A 1968 car crash in France and the 1998 diagnosis of Ann Romney’s multiple sclerosis offer clues into Mitt Romney’s character, and how he reacts to challenges.

docs.lead_paragraph: Even though the states can barely meet their core responsibilities now, Mitt Romney wants to increase their burdens by unloading several federal duties.

headline.seo: Romney’s Plan: Dump It on the States

docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Mitt Romney for his plan to unload several federal duties, including Medicaid and other safety net programs, onto states that are already having trouble meeting their core responsibilities.
docs.snippet: Even though the states can barely meet their core responsibilities now, Mitt Romney wants to increase their burdens by unloading several federal duties.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors and patients respond to a front-page article.
docs.snippet: Doctors and patients respond to a front-page article.

docs.lead_paragraph: Auto accidents that cause major injuries are rare, but it still may be worth examining how much insurance coverage you have.

headline.main: How to Know if You Have Enough Auto Insurance
headline.print_headline: How to Know if You Have Enough Auto Insurance

docs.abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column says auto accidents that cause major injuries are rare, but it still may be worth examining how much insurance coverage one has.
docs.snippet: Auto accidents that cause major injuries are rare, but it still may be worth examining how much insurance coverage you have.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republicans are sensing an opportunity to cut into the advantage that President Obama had among Catholic voters in 2008.

headline.seo: Cardinal Dolan’s Convention Role Shows G.O.P.’s Push for Catholic Vote
headline.main: Invitation to Cardinal Shows G.O.P.’s Catholic Push
headline.print_headline: Invitation to Cardinal Shows G.O.P.’s Catholic Push

docs.abstract: Decision by Republicans to have Cardinal Timothy M Dolan deliver the closing prayer at the Republican National Convention may be the clearest sign yet of a more aggressive push by the party to win over Roman Catholic voters this election cycle.
docs.snippet: The Republicans are sensing an opportunity to cut into the advantage that President Obama had among Catholic voters in 2008.

docs.lead_paragraph: As nutrition is becoming more important to customers, the grocery business is finding dietitians indispensable for fending off competition from specialty markets.

headline.main: Employing Dietitians Pays Off for Supermarkets
headline.print_headline: Dietitians Go Where the Food Is

docs.abstract: Grocery business is finding in-store dietitians indispensable for tapping a growing customer interest in nutrition, as it fends off competition from specialty markets and big-box stores; Hy-Vee is the only grocery chain in the country that posts a registered dietician in almost every one of its 235 stores.
docs.snippet: As nutrition is becoming more important to customers, the grocery business is finding dietitians indispensable for fending off competition from specialty markets.

docs.lead_paragraph: While deciding to purchase long-term care insurance is a complex decision, it is one that women, in particular, may want to spend some time considering. Nearly two-thirds of new claims under long-term care policies in 2011 were made by women, according to the latest data from an industry group. The data was reported by the American Association for Long-Term Care Insurance in its annual "sourcebook" released this summer.
docs.abstract: Bucks blog; nearly two-thirds of new claims under long-term care policies in 2011 were made by women; they have longer life expectancies than men, and are more likely to live alone at advanced ages. (S)
docs.snippet: While deciding to purchase long-term care insurance is a complex decision, it is one that women, in particular, may want to spend some time considering. Nearly two-thirds of new claims under long-term care policies in 2011 were made by women,...

docs.lead_paragraph: 11:02 p.m. | Updated WASHINGTON - Mitt Romney could hardly have been more scornful of Washington politicians during a visit with conservative activists this year.

headline.main: Political Memo: By Adding Ryan as Running Mate, Romney Loses Outsider Status

docs.abstract: Political Memo; Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney's selection of Rep Paul D Ryan as his running mate undercuts his longstanding campaign theme of being a Washington outsider. (M)
docs.snippet: 11:02 p.m. | Updated    WASHINGTON - Mitt Romney could hardly have been more scornful of Washington politicians during a visit with conservative activists this year.

headline.main: With Ryan, Romney Loses Claim to Outsider Status
headline.print_headline: Political Memo: By Adding Ryan as Running Mate, Romney Loses Outsider Status

docs.abstract: In choosing Paul D. Ryan to be his running mate, Mitt Romney tapped a congressman with a long and sometimes contentious legislative record.
docs.snippet: In choosing Paul D. Ryan to be his running mate, Mitt Romney tapped a congressman with a long and sometimes contentious legislative record.

headline.main: Evidence vs. Ideology in the Medicare Debate

docs.abstract: If Republican leaders were serious about strengthening Medicare, they would find a way to lower costs, rather than passing on the risk of higher premiums to the elderly.
docs.snippet: If Republican leaders were serious about strengthening Medicare, they would find a way to lower costs, rather than passing on the risk of higher premiums to the elderly.
